title: Katy Perry - Firework (Official Music Video)
description:
CELEBRATING TEN YEARS OF TEENAGE DREAM!!
REMASTERED IN 4K!
Get “Firework” from Katy Perry’s ‘Teenage Dream’: http://katy.to/TeenageDream

Katy Perry Complete Collection on Spotify: http://katy.to/SpotifyCompleteYD
Katy Perry Essentials on Apple Music: http://katy.to/AMEssentialsYD
Watch your favorite Katy videos on YouTube: http://katy.to/MusicVideosYD

Directed by Dave Myers and Produced by Robert Bray & Danny Lockwood


Lyrics:
Do you ever feel
Like a plastic bag
Drifting through the wind
Wanting to start again
Do you ever feel
Feel so paper-thin
Like a house of cards
One blow from caving in
Do you ever feel
Already buried deep
Six feet under
Screams but no one seems to hear a thing
Do you know that there’s
Still a chance for you
‘Cause there’s a spark in you

You just gotta
Ignite the light
And let it shine
Just own the night
Like the Fourth of July

‘Cause baby, you’re a firework
Come on show them what you’re worth
Make them go, “Oh, oh, oh”
As you shoot across the sky
Baby, you’re a firework
Come on let your colors burst
Make them go, “Oh, oh, oh”
You’re gonna leave before they know

You don’t have to feel
Like a waste of space
You’re original
Cannot be replaced
If you only knew
What the future holds
After a hurricane
Comes a rainbow
Maybe the reason why
All the doors are closed
So you could open one
That leads you to the perfect …
Like a lightning bolt
Your heart will glow
And when it’s time you know

You just gotta
Ignite the light
And let it shine
Just own the night
Like the Fourth of July

‘Cause baby, you’re a firework
Come on show them what you’re worth
Make them go, “Oh, oh, oh”
As you shoot across the sky
Baby, you’re a firework
Come on let your colors burst
Make them go, “Oh, oh, oh”
You’re gonna leave before they know

Boom, boom, boom
Even brighter than the moon, moon, moon
It’s always been inside of you, you, you
And now it’s time to let it through

‘Cause baby, you’re a firework
Come on show them what you’re worth
Make them go, “Oh, oh, oh”
As you shoot across the sky
Baby, you’re a firework
Come on let your colors burst
Make them go, “Oh, oh, oh”
You’re gonna leave before they know

Boom, boom, boom
Even brighter than the moon, moon, moon
Boom, boom, boom
Even brighter than the moon, moon, moon

Music video by Katy Perry performing Firework. (C) 2010 Capitol Records, LLC

new_description:
Katy Perry's "Firework": A Decade of Inspiration and Celebration

Released as part of her highly successful album Teenage Dream, Katy Perry's "Firework" has become an anthem for self-empowerment and personal triumph. This song has inspired millions around the globe since its release in 2010. Remastered in 4K, the official music video now offers an enhanced viewing experience that pays homage to its influential legacy. Let's delve into the elements that make "Firework" a perennial favorite in the pop music landscape.

The Concept Behind "Firework"

"Firework" is more than just a pop song; it's a message of self-confidence and inner strength. The lyrics, beginning with a poignant question about feeling lost and unappreciated in the world, quickly transform into a call for listeners to "ignite the light" within themselves. The imagery of fireworks represents the explosive potential each individual holds to shine brightly and influence the world around them.

In interviews, Katy Perry has shared her vision for the song: she aimed to create something that resonated with anyone who has ever doubted their worth. Each verse builds on this idea, leading to a powerful chorus that encourages embracing uniqueness and flaunting one's true colors without fear. The song cleverly aligns these themes with the festive, vibrant burst of fireworks, symbolizing celebration and visibility.

The Making of the Music Video

Directed by the renowned Dave Myers, the "Firework" music video is a visual masterpiece that complements the song's powerful message. The video showcases diverse characters overcoming their struggles, from a teased teenager to a cancer patient confronting her fears. Each narrative culminates in a jubilant display of fireworks, metaphorically representing personal breakthroughs.

Set against a stunning backdrop of Budapest, the video uses both metaphorical and literal elements to convey transformation and resilience. The choice of location, combined with exceptional cinematography, enhances the emotional gravity of the storylines portrayed. The remastered version only heightens these visuals, providing a clearer and more vibrant representation of the initial artistic intent.

Impact and Reception

Upon its release, "Firework" received widespread acclaim from both fans and critics. It not only reached the top of the charts in multiple countries but also earned several award nominations, including a Grammy nod. The song's infectious melody and uplifting lyrics quickly cemented its place in popular culture.

Various organizations and campaigns have also used "Firework" due to its inspiring message. Its themes of empowerment and self-belief resonate well with audiences, making it a staple in motivational contexts. Whether played at events or used in advertisements, the track's positive impact has continued well beyond its initial release.

The Legacy of "Teenage Dream"

"Firework" is just one of the many hits from Katy Perry's Teenage Dream album, which celebrated its tenth anniversary with this remastered release. The album itself was groundbreaking, marking a significant moment in Perry's career with multiple chart-topping singles and record-breaking achievements. Its influence can be seen in how it shaped the direction of pop music in the early 2010s.

The dual celebration of the "Teenage Dream" anniversary alongside "Firework's" enduring popularity highlights the timelessness of Perry's work during this iconic era. Fans old and new are reminded of the vibrant spirit and emotional depth that Perry brings to her music, ensuring that these tracks remain relevant even a decade later.

Katy Perry's Continuing Influence

With each successive release, Katy Perry continues to evolve as an artist. Her ability to infuse meaningful messaging into catchy, commercially successful tracks is a testament to her artistic vision and appeal. Songs like "Firework" exemplify her knack for creating anthems that resonate universally, allowing her to maintain her status as one of the leading figures in the music industry.

This remastering project is not just a reflection of her past achievements but also a sign of her ongoing relevance in the music space. By refreshing these works for a contemporary audience, Perry ensures that her impactful messages remain accessible and continue to inspire future generations.

"Firework" stands as a beacon of self-expression and celebrates the diverse tapestries of personal narratives. It reminds us all of the vibrant potential within, waiting to spark under the right conditions. As the song concludes with the iconic lines about shining "brighter than the moon," viewers are left with a resonant call to action: embrace your brilliance and let it shine unapologetically.
